content: खः The sun. --खं {@--1@} The sky; खं केशवोऽपर इवाक्रमितुं प्रवृत्तः <ls>Mk. 5. 2</ls>; यावद्रिरः खे मरुतां चरंति <ls>Ku. 3. 72</ls>; <ls>Me. 9.</ls> {@--2@} Heaven. {@--3@} Organ of sense. {@--4@} A city. {@--5@} A field. {@--6@} A cypher. {@--7@} A dot, an anusvāra. {@--8@} A cavity, an aperture, hollow, hole; <ls>Ms. 9. 43.</ls> {@--9@} An aperture of the human body; (of which there are 9, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} the mouth, the two ears, the two eyes, the two nostrils, and the organs of excretion and generation); खानि चैव स्पृशेदाद्भिः <ls>Ms. 2. 60</ls>, <ls n="Ms. 2.">53</ls>; <ls n="Ms.">4. 144</ls>; <ls>Y. 1. 20</ls>; <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Ku. 3. 50.</ls> {@--10@} A wound. {@--11@} Happiness, pleasure. {@--12@} Talc. {@--13@} Action. {@--14@} Knowledge. {@--15@} Brahman. {@--16@} The glottis (in anatomy). {@--17@} The tenth from any given constellation or the sun's entrance into it. --खा {@--1@} A well, fountain. {@--2@} A river
